definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Relatives have scolded him, saying he is irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 亲戚们数落他，骂他是不孝子。

sentences.english: The death of my father helped shape me into the person I am today, a dutiful son.
sentences.chinese: 死我的父亲帮助塑造我进入我的今天，一个孝子。

sentences.english: When they grow up they will rebel and become unfilial children.
sentences.chinese: 长大后，自然动辄忤逆反抗，成为一个不孝子。

sentences.english: Firstly, he must be a dutiful son.
sentences.chinese: 首先，他必须是一位孝子。

sentences.english: Give obituary notice it when some unfilial shall kneel down in front of a longer period of time crying.
sentences.chinese: 故有些不孝子报丧时须在舅家门口下跪痛哭较长时间。

sentences.english: He was the black sheep of the family.
It should say that, for mother, I was dutiful son, the farthest son from her.
sentences.chinese: 应该说，对母亲，我是孝子，是离她最远的儿子。

sentences.english: In the eyes of seniors, he is a dutiful son.
sentences.chinese: 他家教甚严，对长辈，他是一个孝子。

sentences.english: Even today, the story of the dutiful son, Dong Yong, still circulates among the residents.
sentences.chinese: 直到今天，这里还流传着孝子董永的故事。

sentences.english: The unfilial son deserves it. What's the sentence?
sentences.chinese: 这种不孝子该告。法院怎么判？

sentences.english: And I as a dutiful son, as they choose that I shall BE descended from you.
sentences.chinese: 我当一个孝子，既然他们选定了我做你的后代。

sentences.english: The "Twenty-Four Stories of Filial Piety" are legendary stories about 24 filial sons and daughters in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 《二十四孝》是一本关于历代二十四个孝子的故事集。

sentences.english: Spare the rod, spoil the child.
Shenzhen earliest Cantonese Wong, is the famous "Guangdong Xiaozai" Huang Shu.
sentences.chinese: 深圳最早的广府黄氏，是著名的“南粤孝子”黄舒。

definition: filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
filial piety (a Confucian obligation)/respect and obedience to one's parents
the Twenty-four Filial Exemplars, classic Confucian text on filial piety from Yuan dynasty
